fields.name: AnonymousGID
fields.description: GID value that replaces 0 when rootSquash is true. This will use the value of anonymousUID if not provided.

fields.name: AnonymousUID
fields.description: UID value that replaces 0 when rootSquash is true. 65534 will be used if not provided.

fields.name: Filter
fields.description: Filter applied to the scope for this rule. The filter's format depends on its scope. 'default' scope matches all clients and has no filter value. 'network' scope takes a filter in CIDR format (for example, 10.99.1.0/24). 'host' takes an IP address or fully qualified domain name as filter. If a client does not match any filter rule and there is no default rule, access is denied.

fields.name: RootSquash
fields.description: Map root accesses to anonymousUID and anonymousGID.

fields.name: Scope
fields.description: Scope for this rule. The scope and filter determine which clients match the rule.

fields.name: SubmountAccess
fields.description: For the default policy, allow access to subdirectories under the root export. If this is set to no, clients can only mount the path '/'. If set to yes, clients can mount a deeper path, like '/a/b'.
